Detailed Description

Defines the parameters of the Walking Pattern Generator.

Member Function Documentation

void WMG::AddFootstep ( double  x_relative,
double  y_relative,
double  angle_relative,
int  _nSS,
int  _n,
int  _RL,
double *  _d 
)

Adds a footstep to FS.

Parameters:
[in]x_relativeX position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step x_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]y_relativeY position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step y_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]angle_relativeAngle [rad.] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step angle_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]_nSSNumber of (preview window) iterations in Single Support.
[in]_nTotal number of (preview window) iterations, i.e., nSS + nDS.
[in]_RLRight or left foot (1 for left, -1 for right).
[in]_dVector of the PoS constraints (assumed to be [4 x 1]).
Note:
For now, it is assumed that there can not be a right support after right support (likewise for left support). In other words FS[i+1].RL = -FS[i].RL. Hence we can only set FootStep.RL for the first "virtual" step.

Definition at line 161 of file WMG.cpp.

void WMG::AddFootstep ( double  x_relative,
double  y_relative,
double  angle_relative 
)

Adds a footstep to FS.

Parameters:
[in]x_relativeX position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step x_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]y_relativeY position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step y_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]angle_relativeAngle [rad.] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step angle_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
Attention:
This function assumes that there is at least one footstep in FS.

void WMG::AddFootstep ( double  x_relative,
double  y_relative,
double  angle_relative,
int  _nSS,
int  _n 
)

Adds a footstep to FS.

Parameters:
[in]x_relativeX position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step x_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]y_relativeY position [meter] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step y_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]angle_relativeAngle [rad.] relative to the previous footstep (only for the first "virtual" step angle_relative is with respect to the world frame.)
[in]_nSSNumber of (preview window) iterations in Single Support.
[in]_nTotal number of (preview window) iterations, i.e., nSS + nDS.
Attention:
This function assumes that there is at least one footstep in FS.

void WMG::FormPreviewWindow ( )

Forms the preview window. Using only single support!

Note:
If the i-th step is old, then it will have FS[i].n = 0

Definition at line 321 of file WMG.cpp.

void WMG::slide ( ) [private]

Increase counter. Decrease FS[current_step_number].n or increase current_step_number.

Note:
This function should be called each time before we update the preview window using FormPreviewWindow (except for the first time).

int WMG::current_step_number

This is the step in FS that is at the start of the current preview window. I don't need to pop_front steps from FS and that is why I use stl vector and not stl deque).
